title: 8 Mid-Century Modern Furniture Finds to Add Retro Style to Your Space
text:
Mansion Global has highlighted these products and services because we think readers will find them useful. We may earn a commission if you buy products through our links, but our recommendations are independent of any compensation that we may receive.

Clean lines, expert craftsmanship, distinctive forms—though Mid-century Modern furniture was created in the mid-1900s, its appeal is timeless with a look that’s still reproduced at record pace today. Revered for its simplicity, the style often paired two materials and colors together along with a well-executed design. But the furniture wasn’t one note: There was everything from Eero Saaranin’s plush and enveloping womb chair to Isamu Noguchi’s architectural Noguchi table, which has a sculptural quality.



If you’re in the market for authentic period pieces, there are many to be had through auction sites. Or, you can simply shop most major retailers to find furniture that takes its cue from the era.



We’ve looked around to find some of our favorite Mid-century Modern pieces on the market.



Design Within Reach Egg Chair

The famous Egg Chair is as comfortable as it is stylish. Design Within Reach

First designed by Arne Jacobsen in 1958 for the SAS Royal Hotel in Copenhagen, the iconic Egg Chair features fluid curves and a single molded shell to hug the body. The upholstered design sits on a swiveling base and tilts back for lounging. Crafted in fabric or leather by hand onto the aluminum base, this authentic chair is made in Poland.



The Egg Chair starts at $8,251.

Christopher Knight Home Living Coastwood Mid Century Fusion Teal New Velvet Ottoman

This ottoman offers extra seating space or a spot to hold a tray of food. Amazon

With its low profile, wooden legs and teal tufted velvet, this Christopher Knight Home Living Coastwood Mid Century Fusion Teal New Velvet Ottoman makes a statement in any living room. This versatile piece can double as extra seating or serve as a rest for a tray of food.



The Christopher Knight Home Living Coastwood Ottoman is available for about $105.



VASAGLE Retro TV Stand

This retro-style TV stand is clearly inspired by Mid-Century Modern design, with its canted legs. Amazon

Mid-century inspired, the VASAGLE Retro TV Stand adds a vintage vibe anywhere you place it. Crafted from rubberwood, the piece features two shelves and a push-to-open cabinet door. Supported by quintessential canted legs, a hallmark of the period, this entertainment center also goes with any color scheme.



The VADAGLE Retro TV Stand is available for $100.



Modani Federica Lounge Chair

This lounge chair adds a pop of color to any living space. Modani

Evocative of the biomorphic shapes that were popularized by Midcentury design, this Modani Federica Lounge Chair features a plush, ergonomic construction and a vibrant pop of color. Curved chrome legs in a gold gleam finish add a sleek touch.

The Modani Federica Lounge Chair is available for $420.

Joybird Aubrey Sofa

The angular design and poppy hue give this sofa a 1960s feel. Joybird

Winged arms and a sweeping curved high back define the look of this retro Joybird Aubrey Sofa. The angular design and poppy hue are reminiscent of 1960s-era sofas.Shown in Vibe Aquatic, the couch comes in a multitude of shades from basic to bold. Angled walnut legs and a tufted design deliver a throwback focus.

The Joybird Aubrey Sofa is available for $1,424.

Manhattan Comfort Avesta Double Side Table

This funky piece of furniture is also very functional. Amazon

As funky as it is functional, Manhattan Comfort Avesta Double Side Table does double duty as a console or TV cabinet. It hides three shelves behind its colorful doors and features the splayed legs that evoke the feel of Midcentury design. And undoubtedly, it’s sure to spark conversation in any capacity.

Manhattan Comfort Avesta Double Side Table is available for about $155.

Simple Living Products Margo Mid Century Bookshelves

This bookshelf allows you to show off your stash of books in Mid-century style. Amazon

Whether you have tchotchkes to display or books to store, these Simple Living Products Margo Mid Century Bookshelves create a dignified display that adds instant flair. The stacked open cubes lend old-school character to your wall space.



The Simple Living Products Margo Mid Century Bookshelves are available for about $250.

Mid-Century Modern Noguchi Style Biomorphic Glass Coffee Table



The biomorphic coffee table was nicknamed the "Airplane Table." 1stDibs

This authentic biomorphic coffee table was crafted circa 1950 in the style of Isamu Noguchi’s iconic Noguchi table. It was nicknamed the "Airplane Table" on account of its intertwined oak plywood legs, which hold an amorphous glass tabletop. It’s guaranteed to give any living room Midcentury style and some serious street cred.



The Mid-Century Modern Noguchi Style Biomorphic Glass Coffee Table is available for $2,695.
